content: The "Drug Free Sports Act" defines terms like "Secretary" and "professional sports associations" and mandates mandatory drug testing for athletes. The "Drug Free Sports Act" mandates professional sports associations to implement drug testing policies for athletes, including random testing at least once a year. The "Drug Free Sports Act" requires professional sports associations to conduct random drug tests on athletes at least once a year without prior notification. The "Drug Free Sports Act" mandates random drug testing of athletes by professional sports associations, administered by an independent party. Positive tests result in a minimum 2-year suspension from participation in the association. An athlete who tests positive for drugs in a professional sports association will face a permanent suspension if they have previously tested positive. The fine can increase by $1,000,000 per day of noncompliance. The Secretary must provide a report every 2 years on the effectiveness of regulations and compliance by professional sports associations.
